comments.body: Do you mean brighter than it currently does?  Because magma blocks give off a light level of 3.
Could you please put this in a more simpler manner?

The magma blocks legitemately give off light, although not how they used to do. In an earlier version of minecraft, magma blocks would copy the light level of other light scources and match up with them. There was no reverse for this except  breaking the magma.
Switch to bedrock windows 10 or get a better graphics system for your Xbox.  On windows 10 the max render distance is 64 chunks and on an upgraded Xbox the max render distance is 96 chunks.

I bought my new iPad (very expensive) so I could be able to enjoy the high render distance. It lasted about a week and now I can only have 13 ;-; where‚Äôs my 32 chunk render distance Mojang? Let us have it as an option at least please.
Stop.

I'd love Striders to have only their eyes above the lava, revealing their long charcoal legs like a cool surprise.
I think that Strides should move in lava faster
Striders walk. That's why they are called striders. I don't think this is what Minecraft was looking for.
This seems pretty cool! I hate the idea of people making Minecraft realistic, but this is awesome!
Neat idea. But i think minecraft is better as it is.
I like this! It brings attention to real-world issues

I totally agree.
It is so annoying to not be able to know which is which.

Possibly blue with an eye of ender texture in place of where a bow would be in the center of the ribbons and wrapping paper.

I agree, I like the idea of a purple present to go with the purple theme of the end, its a little annoying not knowing the difference. I would be happy if they were different from each other, whatever way they do it.
(Despite having gameplay changes, I have catorgristed this as graphics because it is rare to have them have actual changes, in either the sandstorm or the storm)
Indeed, a very great Idea. I also propose that any wind from 50% gets to move the player ever so slightly from there position to the position opposite to the wind.
I think this is a great idea I especially like the uprooting of plants and leaves. But I think that items should also move in the wind

I think this is a good idea, but I don't think the arrow needs to be very bright. You can make it a slightly lighter color than the hopper itself.
Not possible on Java Edition, as DLSS does not support OpenGL
I made my console to 120 fps and my monitor is 144Hz but it still feels like 50fps
Legacy versions run at over 60fps on older consoles, but bedrock on xbox one can't even reach 60 with bad settings.

Maybe it could be just particles, with more intensity depending on the fall.
It would be easier.

well particles makes lag too, maybe they can just configure an other particle system that imitates the splash of the caves & cliff part 1 trailer, so that it won't be as lagy as you can expect, maybe it can be even lighter since you would need only 5 particles, one for the circular waves and 4 for the sides of the splash, but it will require an animated texture since i have in mind a static particle system
I agree, there's too many similar wood colors and leaf colors. A wilted brown leaf, or pink cherry blossom leaf blocks, will be great to have in the future!
Yeah, that's right!

I would love a mossy green- yellowish wood type but even if mojang things it doesn't suit the mangrove tree as a color, then definitely they should change the wood color to a darker shade towards red to differentiate it from acacia and jungle wood

I don‚Äôt think it should be green because it‚Äôs inconsistent and although it‚Äôs unique, I think people would soon realise it doesn‚Äôt look too good. I agree though the mangrove wood is slightly too similar. I think it should be slightly redder with maybe some darker accents. It‚Äôs closer to the real thing and wouldn‚Äôt be too repetitive. Plus, lots of people have wanted slightly reddish-orange wood, it‚Äôs just always been suggested through ‚Äòcherry trees‚Äô being added.

I strongly agree with green-ish mossy wood, because there's currently no way to make green roofs or fences. There's no green stairs and fences in Minecraft! And so, variety in wood colors is important.

Couldn‚Äôt agree more, I feel like it resembles the jungle wood to much and I know that‚Äôs why they showed it off in the jungle to show the difference but I feel like the green wood would give builders a lot more possibilities and it would just feel more natural to have green wood in a swamp biome
Mangrove trees isn't green in real life
I agree, it looks far too similar to jungle wood.
This is because Minecraft's engine does not support colored lighting. This will probably change in the future.

maybe you could attatch the banners to the back of the minecart?

That actually sounds decent, you got a vote from me. I also saw that the night skies seemed dull so I posted an idea of shooting stars and it got 2224 votes so far.
And some meteor showers!
Thanks for the support Kcaz! I saw your shooting star post and I too voted for it and I hope to see both of our ideas added. :)
I can see how this could be useful, but it also seems overly complicated.  Especially since it's mostly useful for the person who is taking the damage, and they're the one who can see it least well.
I've simplified it now.
I think Kelly's RTX resource pack is what your looking for, its basically vanilla Minecraft textures with RTX.

i second this.  its not that i'm not ok with getting my rtx stuff outside of the game but it is honestly much less user-friendly to have to do so.  i'd like to be able to just click a button n say i want rtx on my end while family on whatever they chose to play on does what they need to on there end and have the same basic textures , not all of them have a good pc or even a pc at this point.  also yes i too don't like that 'laminated' look its why i never use the rtx packs since most just look off to me , i would honestly much rather have the option for shaders.
Just turn off texture packs (I think you can do that) and then go super far away and then turn yourself into survival mode.

Yes, seeing as some mobile devices can get better render distance as a 12 teraflop console. If the series X is truly on par with a 2080 Super like the claims say, the. We really shouldn‚Äôt have a problem getting render distance at least to 48 (that is probably low-balling) they even showed a tech demo of the Raytracing running on it leading up to the system‚Äôs launch, which is a bit ambitious, but hey, if they can get it stable, why not.

I can confirm.

I think I understand the idea behind this "auto exposure". But there needs to be a cutoff where bright stuff stays bright, and in that particular instance, dark stuff stays dark.

A cave without any light source should be pitch black.

Yes, please make this "Night vision" toggle-able so that we can have the option to not have caves in RTX permanently dimly lit, I can't understand the reason for this at all.  Almost seems like a bug to me, I won't play it until it is fixed, I am sure I am not the only one that thinks this.

EDIT:  Just checked it seems to do it with non RTX textures too on windows 10 version, not tried Java version yet.

I have to agree with this, i understand that in normal minecraft, its neccesary to have at least a little bit of light from a gameplay standpoint, but with RTX bringing lighting closer to how it is in real life, i think it would only be fair for it to be completely dark in unlit rooms.

Agreed, renders torches in caves useless from a visual perspective since they will make your surroundings actually darker than the obnoxiously well-lit cave you get without them. Breaks the game immersion in RTX which otherwise would be fantastic to actually get to play through in survival mode.
I fully agree, the auto exposure in some instances looks so bad id rather play without rtx like in huge caves in the 1.19 update

The areas which were 100% dark in Vanilla no longer have that true darkness anymore which ruins a lot of sceneic setups. It's awful that for full darkness you need to have a light source in the view to "outshine" the dark parts of the scene
